text: CCSS.Math.Content.HSA.REI.D.11 Explain why the x -coordinates of the points where the graphs of the equations y = f ( x ) and y = g ( x ) intersect are the solutions of the equation f ( x ) = g ( x ); find the solutions approximately, e.g., using technology to graph the functions, make tables of values, or find successive approximations. Include cases where f ( x ) and/or g ( x ) are linear, polynomial, rational, absolute value, exponential, and logarithmic functions.
